import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import "./CoLab.css"; import Timeline from './Timeline'; import { Helmet } from 'react-helmet'; import NavbarHero from './NavbarHero'; import Navbar from './Navbar' import Carousel from './Carousel'; const timelineEvents = [ { year: "2023", description: "Launch CoLab, Hire Staff, Governance Framework" }, { year: "2024 Output 1", description: "Launch Climate Assessment Report" }, { year: "2024 Output 2", description: "At least 1 decision workflow, Launch Climate Internship" }, { year: "2024 Output 3", description: "At least 1 data product, modeling study, external funding & policy brief" }, // Add more events here INCREASE OR DECREASE PADDING WHEN ADDING TO TIMELINE ]; const CoLab = () => { const [isMobile, setIsMobile] = useState(window.innerWidth <= 768); useEffect(() => { const handleResize = () => setIsMobile(window.innerWidth <= 768); window.addEventListener('resize', handleResize); return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize); }, []); return (
UT City CoLab {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* Header */} {isMobile ? : }
{/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* What is CoLab? */}

What is
the CoLab?

The UT City & Climate CoLab is a collaborative initiative based at the University of Texas at Austin focused on addresing climate change and its impact on urban areas. It brings together researchers, policymakers, and community members to develop innovative solutions and strategies for building climate-resilient cities.

Learn More
{/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* Problems */}
{/* */}

Problems to Solve

Data Support

Fills a void of directly supporting City climate data needs.

Department Connectivity

City data needs vary across departments. Data need to be connected to city department decision making.

Accessibility

Specific data and models are often confusing for community and staff. The goal is to make research accessible to all.

Stakeholder Partnerships

UT/ City climate research projects need stakeholder partnerships to be successful.

{/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* Urgency */}

Urgency

  • Increase in the climate extremes; city needs to prepare for eventualities.
  • Disadvantaged communities greatly challenged in “bouncing back”.
  • Infrastructure and response plans underway.
  • Students interested in place-based research.
  • Federal grant opportunities are growing.
{/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/} {/* Quote Picture Section */}
) } export default CoLab;
